newsitem.title: USA: AT&T in $1.1 billion deal with Textron.
newsitem.headline: AT&T in $1.1 billion deal with Textron.

text.p: Textron Inc. and AT&T Corp. said Tuesday they have signed a $1.1 billion, 10-year contract for AT&T to handle Textron's worldwide communications system.
The companies said the contract should save Textron $125 million over 10 years by centralizing Textron's communications infrastructure, which serves the conglomerate's 25 divisions worldwide.
The contract calls for AT&T to upgrade, expand and manage Textron's communications network, the companies said.

New York-based AT&T said its Solutions subsidiary will engineer, design and implement a comprehensive networking platform encompassing all of the company's voice, data, and video requirements worldwide.

"We are continuing to build and expand our global networking infrastructure to support Textron's growth goals, which include generating over 35 percent of our revenues from outside the United States by the year 2000," said William Gauld, vice president of Textron.
Textron, with revenues exceeding $9 billion, has businesses in aircraft, automotive, industrial, systems and components and finance.
AT&T Solutions has more than 11,000 employees around the world servicing more than 200 clients.
Textron's stock was unchanged at $86.625, while AT&T's stock rose 50 cents to $53.50 early on the New York Stock Exchange.
